title: Wildlife Conservation Enactment 1997
text:
The Wildlife Conservation Enactment 1997 () is a regional piece of <a href="legislation">legislation</a> enforced only in the state of <a href="Sabah">Sabah</a> in <a href="Malaysian%20Borneo">Malaysian Borneo</a>. Its aim is to protect the <a href="endangered%20species">endangered species</a> of <a href="fauna">fauna</a> and <a href="flora">flora</a> in the region as well as control international trade of these species. It also details specific punishments for those that break the rules and regulations put forth in the enactment.
Structure.
The Wildlife Conservation Enactment 1997, in its current form (27 April 2016), consists of 12 Parts containing 119 sections and 5 schedules.
